required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Two Marketed Lenses in a Controlled Environment

brief_summary.textblock: This study is comparing two silicone hydrogel contact lenses in a controlled environment for identification of characteristics associated to vision.

primary_outcome.description: The non-invasive tear film break-up-time (NIBUT) is the time elapsed (in seconds) between eye opening after a blink, and the appearance of the first dark spot within the tear film when observed with the wide diffuse light source of the Tearscope. This measurement is indicative of the tear film stability and the on eye wettability of contact lenses.

The Time Controlled Visual Acuity test is a proprietary test part of MG Vision Advanced Visual Performance Assessment. The test for distance vision is carried out at 4m under high contrast and dim luminance. The test is presented on a fast response 17" LCD screen (1280 by 1064). The test for intermediate vision is carried out at 64cm under high contrast dim luminance. The test was presented on a fast response 13.3" LCD screen (3200 by 1800). Visual acuity will be measured in a controlled environment using logMAR units.

arm_group.description: Subjects were randomized to one of two lens wear sequences. Subjects randomized to this sequence first wore the senofilcon A contact lens and then wore the lotrafilcon B contact lens.
Subjects were randomized to one of two lens wear sequences. Subjects randomized to this sequence first wore the lotrafilcon B contact lens and then wore the senofilcon A contact lens

intervention.description: Each study contact lens will be worn as daily wear modality for a period of 2 weeks each.
Each study contact lens will be worn as daily wear modality for a period of 2 weeks each.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 45 subjects were enrolled into this study. Of the enrolled subjects 43 were dispensed and 2 subjects did not meet the eligibility criteria. Of the 43 dispensed subjects, 1 subject was discontinued 42 subjects completed the study.

group.title: Senofilcon A/ Lotrafilcon B
group.description: Subjects that received the senofilcon A contact lens in the first period and then received the lotrafilcon B contact lens in the second period.

group.title: Lotrafilcon B / Senofilcon A
group.description: Subjects that received the lotrafilcon B contact lens in the first period and then received the senofilcon A contact lens in the second period.

baseline.population: All subjects that were dispensed at least one study lens.

group.title: Dispensed Subjects
group.description: All subjects that were dispensed at least one lens throughout the duration of the study.

outcome.title: Tear Film Kinetics
outcome.description: The non-invasive tear film break-up-time (NIBUT) is the time elapsed (in seconds) between eye opening after a blink, and the appearance of the first dark spot within the tear film when observed with the wide diffuse light source of the Tearscope. This measurement is indicative of the tear film stability and the on eye wettability of contact lenses.
outcome.population: The analysis population consists of subjects that completed all study visits without a major protocol deviation (per-protocol). One subjects was excluded from the analysis population due to a major protocol deviation.

group.title: Senofilcon A
group.description: Subjects that received the senofilcon A contact lens in either the first or second period of the study.

group.title: Lotrafilcon B
group.description: Subjects that received the lotrafilcon B in either the first or second period of the study.

measure.title: Tear Film Kinetics
measure.description: The non-invasive tear film break-up-time (NIBUT) is the time elapsed (in seconds) between eye opening after a blink, and the appearance of the first dark spot within the tear film when observed with the wide diffuse light source of the Tearscope. This measurement is indicative of the tear film stability and the on eye wettability of contact lenses.
measure.population: The analysis population consists of subjects that completed all study visits without a major protocol deviation (per-protocol). One subjects was excluded from the analysis population due to a major protocol deviation.

outcome.title: Time Controlled Visual Acuity
outcome.description: The Time Controlled Visual Acuity test is a proprietary test part of MG Vision Advanced Visual Performance Assessment. The test for distance vision is carried out at 4m under high contrast and dim luminance. The test is presented on a fast response 17” LCD screen (1280 by 1064). The test for intermediate vision is carried out at 64cm under high contrast dim luminance. The test was presented on a fast response 13.3” LCD screen (3200 by 1800). Visual acuity will be measured in a controlled environment using logMAR units.
outcome.population: The analysis population consists of subjects that completed all study visits without a major protocol deviation. The analysis was conducted for each lens at both near (40cm) and far distance (4m).

group.title: Senofilcon A
group.description: Subjects that received the senofilcon A contact lens in either the first or second period of the study.

group.title: Lotrafilcon B
group.description: Subjects that received the lotrafilcon B contact lens in either the first or second period of the study.

measure.title: Time Controlled Visual Acuity
measure.description: The Time Controlled Visual Acuity test is a proprietary test part of MG Vision Advanced Visual Performance Assessment. The test for distance vision is carried out at 4m under high contrast and dim luminance. The test is presented on a fast response 17” LCD screen (1280 by 1064). The test for intermediate vision is carried out at 64cm under high contrast dim luminance. The test was presented on a fast response 13.3” LCD screen (3200 by 1800). Visual acuity will be measured in a controlled environment using logMAR units.
measure.population: The analysis population consists of subjects that completed all study visits without a major protocol deviation. The analysis was conducted for each lens at both near (40cm) and far distance (4m).

reported_events.time_frame: Throughout the duration of the study. Approximately 1 month per subject.

group.title: Senofilcon A
group.description: Subjects that received the senofilcon A contact lens in either the first or second period of the study.

group.title: Lotrafilcon B
group.description: Subjects that received the lotrafilcon B contact lens in either the first or second period of the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
